soon.title: Coming soon
soon.description: The Store application is not fully available yet, we are still working on it. For more information, please contact us at contact@cozycloud.cc.

uninstall.title: Uninstall this application
uninstall.description: This application is bound to be removed from your Cozy %{cozyName}. Are you sure to __remove this application definitively__?
uninstall.uninstallable_description: This application is a major part of the Cozy platform. In order to keep you a __minimum user experience quality__, it's not possible to uninstall it through the Store application.

message.success: The application has correctly been uninstalled.
message.error: Something went wrong when uninstalling this application. Reason: %{message}

install.title: The application %{appName} will not transmit any personal data to any third parties.
install.accept_description: By electing __Install__, you accept that the application %{appName} obtains access to these data, only locally and within your Cozy, and in compliance with the terms of service and the privacy policy.

permissions.nothing: The application %{appName} doesn't require any data access to work correctly on your Cozy (%{cozyName}).
permissions.description: In order to improve the value of your Cozy (%{cozyName}), the application %{appName} requires access to the following data:

message.install_success: The application has correctly been installed.
message.update_success: The application has correctly been updated.
message.version_error: Something went wrong when fetching the application informations. Reason: %{message}
message.install_error: Something went wrong when installing the application on your Cozy. Reason: %{message}

HiddenInstallerView.title: Application installation
HiddenInstallerView.conflict: An application with the same slug already exists. Please change it.
HiddenInstallerView.source_examples:
#### Source documentation: 
* `registry://`: to install an application from __the instance registries__ 
* `git://` or `git+ssh://`: to install an application from __a git repository__ 
* `http://` or `https://`: to install an application from __an http(s) server (via a tarball)__ 
#### Source examples: 
* `registry://drive/stable`, `registry://drive/beta`, or `registry://drive/dev` 
* `git://github.com/cozy/cozy-collect.git#build` 
* `https://github.com/cozy/cozy-collect/archive/v3.0.3.tar.gz` 
#### [Link to complete cozy-stack docs](https://cozy.github.io/cozy-stack/apps.html#sources)
